    • DERIVATIVE_SWITCH_ITERATION

      private static final int DERIVATIVE_SWITCH_ITERATION
      Iteration threshold to switch from simple to derivative-based iterations. First iterations use simple M_matrix (cheap), then switch to derivatives for faster quadratic convergence near the solution.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DERIVATIVE_SWITCH_ERROR

      private static final double DERIVATIVE_SWITCH_ERROR
      Error threshold to switch to derivative-based iterations. When relative error falls below this, use derivatives for faster convergence.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • useFugacityDerivatives

      private boolean useFugacityDerivatives
      Flag to enable fugacity coefficient derivatives in M_matrix. When true, uses init(3) for derivative calculations and includes dln(fugacity)/dN terms for more accurate Newton steps. Default is false for backward compatibility and performance.

    • useAdaptiveDerivatives

      private boolean useAdaptiveDerivatives
      Flag to enable automatic switching to derivatives after initial iterations. When true, starts with simple iterations then switches to derivatives for faster convergence.

    • useFullMMatrix

      private boolean useFullMMatrix
      Flag to enable the full Smith-Missen M-matrix with the -1/n_t coupling term. When true, uses M_ij = δ_ij/n_i - 1/n_t instead of the simplified M_ij = δ_ij/n_i. The full form provides better quadratic convergence near the solution but may be less stable for some systems. Default is false for backward compatibility and stability.

    • maxIterations

      private int maxIterations
      Maximum iterations allowed (configurable). Default is MAX_ITERATIONS.

    • convergenceTolerance

      private double convergenceTolerance
      Convergence tolerance for relative mole change. Default is 1e-8.

    • lastIterationCount

      private int lastIterationCount
      Number of iterations from the last solve() call.

    • lastError

      private double lastError
      Final relative error from the last solve() call.

    • lastConverged

      private boolean lastConverged
      Whether the last solve() call converged successfully.

    • updateMoles

      public void updateMoles()

      updateMoles.

      Updates the moles in the reactive phase based on the calculated n_mol values from the Newton solver. Uses Phase.addMolesChemReac with totdn=0 to only affect phase moles without corrupting the total system moles (which would violate element conservation).

    • solve

      public boolean solve()

      solve.

      Returns:
      a boolean

    • enforceMinimumIonConcentrations

      private void enforceMinimumIonConcentrations()
      Enforce minimum physically reasonable concentrations for ionic species.

      When the chemical equilibrium solver fails to converge, ionic species like H3O+ and OH- can be left at unrealistically low values. This method checks the water auto-ionization equilibrium (Kw = [H3O+][OH-]) and corrects unrealistic values while respecting legitimate acidic or alkaline conditions.

      The method only intervenes when both H3O+ and OH- are unrealistically low (violating Kw), not when the solution is legitimately acidic (high H3O+, low OH-) or alkaline (low H3O+, high OH-).

    • reinitializeAfterIonAdjustment

      private void reinitializeAfterIonAdjustment()
      Reinitialize the system after ion concentration adjustment.

    • isUseFugacityDerivatives

      public boolean isUseFugacityDerivatives()
      Check if fugacity coefficient derivatives are used in the M_matrix calculation.
      Returns:
      true if fugacity derivatives are enabled

    • setUseFugacityDerivatives

      public void setUseFugacityDerivatives(boolean useFugacityDerivatives)
      Enable or disable fugacity coefficient derivatives in M_matrix calculation.

      When enabled, the solver uses init(3, phase) to calculate fugacity derivatives and includes dln(fugacity)/dN terms in the M_matrix for more accurate Newton steps. This can improve convergence for non-ideal mixtures but is computationally more expensive.

      Parameters:
      useFugacityDerivatives - true to enable, false to disable

    • isUseAdaptiveDerivatives

      public boolean isUseAdaptiveDerivatives()
      Check if adaptive derivative switching is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if adaptive derivatives are enabled

    • setUseAdaptiveDerivatives

      public void setUseAdaptiveDerivatives(boolean useAdaptiveDerivatives)
      Enable or disable adaptive derivative switching.

      When enabled, the solver starts with simple iterations (without fugacity derivatives) for the first few iterations, then automatically switches to derivative-based iterations for faster quadratic convergence near the solution. This combines the robustness of simple iterations with the speed of derivative-based methods.

      The switch occurs after DERIVATIVE_SWITCH_ITERATION iterations or when the error falls below DERIVATIVE_SWITCH_ERROR.

      Parameters:
      useAdaptiveDerivatives - true to enable adaptive switching, false to disable

    • isUseFullMMatrix

      public boolean isUseFullMMatrix()
      Check if full Smith-Missen M-matrix is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if full M-matrix with -1/n_t term is enabled

    • setUseFullMMatrix

      public void setUseFullMMatrix(boolean useFullMMatrix)
      Enable or disable the full Smith-Missen M-matrix.

      When enabled, the M-matrix uses the full form M_ij = δ_ij/n_i - 1/n_t instead of the simplified form M_ij = δ_ij/n_i. The -1/n_t term couples all species through total moles and can improve quadratic convergence near the solution, but may be less stable for some systems.

      Parameters:
      useFullMMatrix - true to enable full M-matrix, false to use simplified form

    • getMaxIterations

      Get the maximum number of iterations allowed for the solver.

    • solveLeastSquares

      private Jama.Matrix solveLeastSquares(Jama.Matrix A, Jama.Matrix b)
      Solve least-squares problem using SVD pseudo-inverse.

      For rank-deficient or ill-conditioned matrices, this provides a more robust solution than direct inversion. Uses SVD decomposition: A = U * S * V^T, then x = V * S^(-1) * U^T * b.

      Parameters:
      A - the coefficient matrix
      b - the right-hand side vector
      Returns:
      the least-squares solution x
